source_text:
# Photosynthesis

Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy. 
This process occurs in chloroplasts and involves multiple steps.

## Light Reactions
The light reactions capture solar energy and convert it to chemical energy in the form of ATP and NADPH.

## Calvin Cycle
The Calvin cycle uses the products of light reactions to fix carbon dioxide and produce sugars.

blueprint_json.source_title: Photosynthesis: Light Reactions and Calvin Cycle

source_summary.core_thesis_or_main_argument: Photosynthesis is a two-stage process: light reactions convert light energy into ATP and NADPH, which the Calvin cycle then uses to fix carbon dioxide and produce sugars.
source_summary.inferred_purpose: To explain the fundamental process of photosynthesis, outlining its two main stages: the light reactions and the Calvin cycle.

Uses the products of light reactions to fix carbon dioxide and produce sugars.

identified_relationships.description: Light reactions are a part of photosynthesis.
Calvin cycle is a part of photosynthesis.
Chloroplasts are a component of the photosynthesis process.
Light reactions provide ATP and NADPH for the Calvin cycle.
The Calvin cycle requires the products of the light reactions.
